title: Set the Equation
text: Let n be the first even number, and the second consecutive number will be $$n+2$$. The equation will be $$n\left(n+2\right)=624$$.

title: Solve the Equation
text: Solve $$n\left(n+2\right)=624$$. You foil out the equation as $$n^2+2n=624$$. $$n^2+2n-624=0$$.

title: Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n.
Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n.
text: Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n when $$n^2+2n-624=0$$. Enter your answer as (a,b) where $$a<b$$.

title: Find Answer Pairs
text: When the first consecutive number is -26, the second consecutive number is $$-26+2=-24$$. When the first consecutive number is 24, the second consecutive number is $$24+2=26$$. The final answer is (-26,-24),(24,26).
